text:
The Aube is a river in France. It is a right tributary of the Seine. The Aube department is named after the river.
Geography.
The Aube river has a length of and a drainage basin with an area of.
Its average yearly discharge (volume of water which passes through a section of the river per unit of time) is at Arcis-sur-Aube in the Aube department.
Course.
The source of the Aube river is in the Langres Plateau, in the "commune" of Praslay, at an altitude of about, in the Haute-Marne department.
Finally, it flows into the Seine river in the town of Marcilly-sur-Seine in the Marne department.
